GWO: Improved Collection of Fees and Receipts
GWO Definition: Ensuring government fees, taxes, and receipts are collected effectively, efficiently, and in full compliance with the law.
Delivering efficient and accessible services and information to U.S. citizens abroad.
Expanding opportunities for international education, exchanges, and cooperation between U.S. institutions and global partners.

GWO: Provide International Development and Humanitarian Assistance
GWO Definition: Delivering effective humanitarian aid and development assistance.
Strengthening America's relationships with foreign governments and international organizations.

GWO: Foster International Economic Empowerment and Opportunities
GWO Definition: Expanding economic opportunities and strengthening conditions for growth in partner nations.
Advancing the skills and readiness of U.S. service members.
Advancing military innovation and technology to maintain America's strategic advantage.
Ensuring U.S. forces remain fully prepared to respond to domestic and foreign threats.
Expanding the quality, scope, and application of agricultural research to improve food production, technologies, sustainability, and resilience in farming and food systems.
Developing and enhancing access to sustainable agricultural practices and systems.
Advancing the competitiveness and resilience of America's farms and rural communities.
Providing businesses with access to capital and investment opportunities to support their growth and competitiveness.
Providing businesses with effective technical assistance to stay competitive in U.S. and global markets.
Expanding the ability of domestic producers and businesses to gain access to access domestic and international markets under fair trade agreements.
Ensuring compliance with U.S. trade laws and regulations.

GWO: Accelerate Development of Commercial Products and Technologies
GWO Definition: Accelerating the creation and market entry of new commercial products and technologies.
Creating new jobs, expanding workforce participation, and supporting pathways to sustained and gainful employment.
Building stronger local economies and resilient business ecosystems in urban, rural, Tribal, and economically distressed regions.
Ensuring access to reliable, high-quality, and affordable internet, phone, and broadband services for communities across the country.

Focus Area: Consumer and Occupational Health and Safety
GWO Definition: Improving workplace conditions, practices, and protections to prevent injuries, illnesses, and fatalities.

Focus Area: Consumer and Occupational Health and Safety
GWO Definition: Protecting the public from unsafe products and services to ensure consumer confidence and safety.
Strengthening the quality of and opportunities for the public to participate in arts and humanities education and programming.

GWO: Strengthen Skill Development within Arts and Humanities Fields
GWO Definition: Developing individuals' artistic abilities, knowledge, and creativity'within the arts and humanities fields.
Providing opportunities for individuals to learn about their own histories, traditions, and languages to foster cultural awareness, appreciation, and lifelong learning.
Expanding opportunities for individuals to learn about the history, traditions, and languages of cultures other than their own to promote cross-cultural dialogue and awareness.
Increasing public engagement and participation with cultural institutions.

GWO: Preserve Culturally or Historically Significant Sites or Artifacts
GWO Definition: Identifying, preserving, and increasing awareness of historic sites, monuments, or heritage assets - focusing specifically on the preservation of physical items.

GWO: Improve Direct Disaster and Emergency Relief
GWO Definition: Improving capabilities to provide timely and effective relief to communities impacted by disasters.

GWO: Increase Disaster Resilience and Response Readiness
GWO Definition: Strengthening communities' ability to withstand, adapt to, and recover from disasters and emergencies.

GWO: Improve Public Health Emergency Preparedness and Response
GWO Definition: Strengthening the ability to prevent, detect, respond to, and recover from public health emergencies.

GWO: Strengthen Early Childhood Education and Childcare
GWO Definition: Ensuring high-quality early learning and childcare for young children and families.
Expanding opportunities for students at all grade levels to engage in high-quality STEM learning and experiences.

GWO: Increase Completion of STEM Degrees, Certificates, and Credentials
GWO Definition: Increasing the number of students who successfully earn degrees, certificates, or credentials in science, technology, engineering or mathematics fields.
Strengthening students' academic foundation, interest, and identity in STEM fields.
Advancing rigorous STEM learning, effective teaching, and environments that inspire curiosity, innovation, and problem-solving.
Ensuring children enter school equipped with age-appropriate literacy, numeracy, cognitive, and social-emotional skills.
Fostering safe, supportive, and high-quality learning environments that foster students' academic and social development.
Building a skilled and effective educator workforce.
Raising student achievement across primary and secondary education and increasing high school graduation.
Increasing the enrollment and consistent attendance of school-age children in K-12 education.

GWO: Provide Finance Options for Post-Secondary Education
GWO Definition: Providing financing opportunities for higher education.
Increasing the number of students who successfully complete a college degree, certificate, or credential program.
Preparing students for entry into post-secondary programs.
Equipping individuals with the skills to effectively and safely use digital technologies, devices, and online resources.

Expanding opportunities for individuals to gain the knowledge, technical skills, and practical experience needed to enter, succeed, and advance in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) careers.
Expanding pathways that enable individuals to return to work and sustain long-term employment.
Improving the reading, writing, numeracy, and comprehension skills of adult learners.

GWO: Strengthen Service and Civic Engagement Workforce Pathways
GWO Definition: Expanding opportunities for volunteering and civic participation for youth and adults to build skills and connect to career pathways.
Increasing the number of individuals entering, advancing, and remaining in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics (STEM) careers.
Strengthening opportunities for individuals to gain the skills and competencies needed to secure, maintain, and advance in employment across industries.
Providing essential, affordable, and reliable utility services to households.
Expanding conventional and renewable energy generation and production within the U.S.
Advancing energy research and innovation to enhance energy efficiency, reliability, and resilience.
Ensuring America's energy systems remain reliable, stable, and resilient to disruptions.
Expanding the quality, scope, and application of environmental research to deepen understanding of ecosystems, natural resources, and environmental challenges.
Improving clean water and air protection, reducing pollution, and implementing sustainable management practices to safeguard human health and water and air ecosystems.
Reducing risks to people, ecosystems, and communities from pollutants and other environmental hazards.
Eliminating or minimizing disruptions in the food supply chain to ensure safe, reliable, and nutritious food is available across American communities.
Enhancing the efficiency of food distribution systems and networks that support getting food from producers and manufacturers to consumers.
Eliminating food insecurity among U.S. households.

GWO: Ensure Stability and Security for Children Without Parents
GWO Definition: Supporting safe, stable, and permanent living arrangements or environments for orphaned children.
Enabling the health and independence of older adults.
Promoting healthier lives and behaviors to improve Americans' overall health and wellness.

GWO: Eliminate Chronic Disease and Risk Factors
GWO Definition: Reducing the prevalence and severity of chronic diseases and associated risk factors.
Reducing the incidence and impact of infectious diseases through prevention and treatment.
Enhancing the reach, quality, and reliability of healthcare so that Americans can access timely, high-quality care in their communities.

Improving quality, access, and availability of affordable healthcare coverage options for consumers, providing financial assistance for health insurance, enforcing key consumer protections and stabilizing health insurance markets, or facilitating care for vulnerable populations like seniors, people with disabilities, or children.
Lowering the cost of prescription drugs and medical care to ease financial burdens and make healthcare more affordable and accessible for all Americans.

GWO: Advance Scientific Research in Health and Medicine
GWO Definition: Supporting medical research and innovation to improve diagnostics, practices, treatments, or preventions.

GWO: Improve Capacity of the Healthcare System
GWO Definition: Strengthening the healthcare system's ability to meet patient and community needs.
Reducing medical errors and safeguarding the privacy of protected personal health information.
Eliminating child abuse and neglect to ensure the safety and well-being of American children.

GWO: Improve the Quality of Care Provided by Healthcare Systems
GWO Definition: Strengthening the overall effectiveness, safety, and patient experience of America's healthcare systems.

GWO: Strengthen Health Education, Communication, and Outreach
GWO Definition: Promote public understanding of health issues to connect those in need with eligible health services.
Enhancing the health and well-being of veterans and their families through high-quality care, benefits, and support.
Eradicating the prevalence and impact of substance use disorders while supporting long-term recovery.

GWO: Eliminate Barriers for People with Disabilities
GWO Definition: Enhancing the physical and mental health, independence, and quality of life of American's living with disabilities.

GWO: Improve Maternal, Infant, and Child Health
GWO Definition: Improving the health and well-being of women, infants, and children to ensure safe pregnancies, healthy births, and strong early development.
Strengthening mental and behavioral health to promote resilience and psychological well-being.
Ensure public health with available, reliable, safe, and hygienic sanitation services.

GWO: Provide Quality Solid Waste Management Systems
GWO Definition: Ensure public health with available, reliable, safe, and efficient solid waste collection, disposal, or recycling services.
Ensure public health with available, reliable, and safe drinking water systems that meet water quality standards.
Eliminating homelessness so that every individual and family has a safe, stable, and permanent place to live.
Open opportunities to affordable and safe housing for eligible individuals and families.
Enable more individuals and families can achieve the American dream of homeownership.
Strengthen the physical condition and safety of residential structures to support occupant's health and well-being.

GWO: Provide Burial Benefits and Services to Veterans
GWO Definition: Providing burial benefits, including burial assistance and memorial services, to eligible veterans and their families.
Provide financial knowledge, tools, or skills to enable individual financial decision-making and literacy.

GWO: Bridge Financial Gaps with Transitional Income Assistance
GWO Definition: Provide individuals or households with a temporary safety net through income security or financial assistance support.

GWO: Advance the Capabilities of the Forensic Sciences
GWO Definition: Strengthening the accuracy, reliability, or integrity of forensic science techniques that are applied in investigations or legal proceedings.
Employment of surveillance capabilities, improved infrastructure, and operational capacity to protect America's national security interests at the border.
Strengthening the ability to detect, respond to, or recover from cyber or digital attacks against critical systems and data.
Protecting American interests against digital or cyber threats that target our networks, infrastructure, or workforce capabilities.
Strengthen or harden the physical security of critical infrastructure facilities and systems to ensure safe and reliable operations in the face of threats.
Increasing the operational capacity and effectiveness of federal, state, and local law enforcement to prevent, respond to, or recover from public safety threats.
Strengthening the support and advocacy for survivors of crime with the resources needed to empower them to rebuild, recover, or navigate the justice system.
Build safer communities that are free from crime.
Elimination of barriers that lead to instances of reincarceration rates while supporting reentry and long-term rehabilitation.
Safeguarding constitutional freedoms and civil rights to ensure equal protection and fair treatment under the law.
Building the capacity of Tribal nations to govern effectively and exercise autonomous, self-determination.
Ending unlawful entry into the United States.
Combat criminal networks and syndicates that operates across international borders.

GWO: Improve Conservation of Natural Habitats and Ecosystems
GWO Definition: Promote adoption of practices for the protection, restoration, and management of natural habitats or ecosystems to maintain their biodiversity and support their resilience.

GWO: Improve Conservation of Wildlife and Natural Resources
GWO Definition: Promote adoption of practices for the protection, restoration, and management of wildlife populations, habitats, or natural resources to maintain biodiversity and support resilience of ecosystems.
Promote adoption of practices for the sustainable management, protection, and restoration of forests and other lands to support ecological health, biodiversity, and resilience.

GWO: Improve Water Resource and Ecosystem Management
GWO Definition: Strengthening the sustainable management and protection of water resources and ecosystems to safeguard their long-term health and availability.
Strengthening the capacity to prevent, respond to, and recover from wildfires in order to protect forests, lands, and natural resources.

GWO: Experience America's Natural Beauty and Public Landscapes
GWO Definition: Expanding recreational opportunities for the public to enjoy the nation's scenic landscapes and public lands.
Advancing science, research, and knowledge across disciplines and sectors.
Enhancing the efficiency, reliability, and reach of infrastructure that transports, stores, and delivers goods from suppliers to markets.
Ensuring the safety, reliability, and capacity of rail systems to meet the needs of passengers, crew, and freight.
Construction or maintenance of public roadway infrastructure system.
Ensuring the safety, reliability, and capacity of aviation systems to meet the needs of passengers, crew, and cargo.
Ensuring the safety, reliability, and capacity of U.S. waterways and ports to meet the needs of passengers, crews, and cargo.
Ensuring reliability, availability, and capacity of public transit modes to meet the needs of all users.
Protecting users of public transit systems across all modes of transportation.
Improving the safety and reliability of public roadways to end traffic-related deaths and injuries.
